704906f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hicks Street - Pineapple Street
704906f-a.text:
Hicks Street (right), north from Pineapple to Fulton Streets (general view northwest), showing in the background, the Squibb's and Eagle Storage buildings; oeyond which are the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges. Also shon, is a vegue outline of Manhattan. The streets from fore to background, are Crange, Cranberry, Middagh Streets, and eto. At the left, is Willow
Street.
June 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
704906f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Pineapple Street, Brooklyn, NY

704917f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hicks Street - Pineapple Street
704917f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Pineapple Street, Brooklyn, NY

704918f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hicks Street - Pineapple Street
704918f-a.text:
95 Hicks Street, adjoining the N. E. corner of Pineapple Street. This house was built in 1840 and was known as the John Wiley House, then at 85 Hicks Street; later
the number was changed to 95.
1922
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
704918f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Pineapple Street, Brooklyn, NY

706282f-a.title: Brooklyn: Pineapple Street - Hicks Street
706282f-a.text:
55-71 Pineapple.Street, north side, between Hicks and Henry Streets. The frame buildings in this view were razed to make way for a 6-story apartment house, called the "St. George Arms".
April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706282f-a.folder: Pineapple Street & Hicks Street, Brooklyn, NY
